WatcherPacketHandler Class Reference

This class is responsible for managing individual watcher path requests, waiting for their responses, and then replying to the requesting process with the collection of watcher path responses. More...

Detailed Description

This class is responsible for managing individual watcher path requests, waiting for their responses, and then replying to the requesting process with the collection of watcher path responses.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum WatcherPacketHandler::WatcherProtocolVersion

Enumeration of different watcher protocol versions the packet handler can respond with.

Enumerator:
WP_VERSION_UNKNOWN  Unknown watcher protocol version.
WP_VERSION_1  Protocol version 1 (string based).
WP_VERSION_2  Protocol version 2.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WatcherPacketHandler::WatcherPacketHandler ( const RemoteEndpoint &  remoteEndpoint,
int32  numPaths,
WatcherProtocolVersion  version,
bool  isSet = false 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
socket The watcher nub endpoint to use when replying to the watcher request.
addr The address of the requesting process we should reply to.
numPaths The number of watcher paths that have been requested, and we should wait to hear responses from.
version The watcher protocol version that is being requested.
isSet Is this watcher request a set operation?

WatcherPacketHandler::~WatcherPacketHandler (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void WatcherPacketHandler::checkSatisfied (  ) 

Check whether all outgoing path requests have responded.

When all requests have responded we can finalise the last outgoing packet and then notify our owner for deletion.

void WatcherPacketHandler::doNotDelete ( bool  shouldNotDelete  ) 

Set a flag to prevent this object from being deleted until it's safe.

Parameters:
shouldNotDelete Should the packet handler be undeleteable?

WatcherPathRequest * WatcherPacketHandler::newRequest ( std::string &  path  )  [virtual]

Create a new WatcherPathRequest associated with the current packet.

Parameters:
path The watcher path the request will query.
Returns:
A pointer to a WatcherPathRequest on success, NULL on error.

Implements WatcherPathRequestNotification.

int32  count 
) [virtual]

Notify the implementing class of a path request completion.

Parameters:
pathRequest The WatcherPathRequest that has been completed.
count The number of replies contained in the path request.
